Test

Test.

class quicklines.Galaxy(id: int, zSpec: Optional[bool] = None, wave: Optional[array] = None, flux: Optional[array] = None, err: Optional[array] = None)

Class that accepts the information of the spectra of one galaxy. If not declared, it can accept a zCOSMOS id from the examples folder

Parameters

id (int) – The Galaxy ID. This can also be zCOSMOS ID which will be cross-matched with the zCOSMOS 20K catalog to retrieve spectroscopic redshift

Returns

galaxy – Blah

Return type

object

class Line(galaxy: Galaxy, linewave: float, window: int = 40, plot: bool = True)

This class defines all the emission line profile measurements

fit() → tuple

Fit a Simple Gaussian Profile to the emission line

find_z_spec() → Union[float, ValueError]

Match with the zCOSMOS catalog to extract the spectroscopic redshift

retrieve_1dspec() → tuple

Get the 1D spectra and load it

run_line(linewave: float, **kwargs) → Line

Instance Line class

quicklines.gaussian(x: array, lineFlux: float, cent_wave: float, sigma: float, cont: float) → array

A simple gaussian function with all the astronomical spectrum line parameters

quicklines.reduced_Chi2(model: array, obs: array, err: array) → float

Calculate the chi^2 statistics to accept or reject the line fitting
